company.name: SVP - Society of St. Vincent de Paul Ireland

volunteer_experiences.description: Involved helping to run a weekly breakfast club for disadvantaged children in Greenmount, Cork City. An important aspect of this volunteering work was to create a safe, open and welcoming environment for children to enjoy a warm breakfast and have a friendly chat. This role involved full Garda-vetting and training.

This voluntary role involved working with an NGO called Edmund Rice International in Geneva as part of the Edmund Rice Education Beyond Borders initiative. Myself and a fellow second level student were among the first youth ambassadors to take part in this programme in Ireland. We worked as a team to encourage and facilitate youth-led advocacy among Irish young people with regards to a range of developmental and social justice issues. The primary focus of this role was to examine the importance of the UN Sustainable Development Goals in a global perspective. I was responsible for presenting and educating younger students on human rights, sustainable development, advocacy and international organizations such as the EU and the UN along with the work and importance of non-governmental organizations. This was done through supporting ERI campaigns along with devising independent awareness strategies. I was part of an international network of ambassadors who shared ideas and supported campaigns to create a global wave of effective social policy change. I visited the United Nations in Geneva as part of this role and attended the 34th Human Rights Council which gave me an insight into the applications of public policy, diplomacy and sustainable development in an international environment.
http://www.edmundriceinternational.org/cms/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/ERI-Youth-Ambassador-Project.pdf

As a member of Ardscoil Na Mara's advocacy group I researched and campaigned politically about contemporary domestic and international social justice issues, particularly homelessness, the migration crisis and domestic violence. I was a founding member of the 'One Campgaign for Change' - a youth led political campaign that lobbied government ministers for policy reform in this area.
I also participated in the Ardscoil Na Mara India immersion programme within this scope of this role, where I volunteered with the NGO Pratyek as part of their 'Nine is Mine' social justice campaign in New Delhi along with the Sai Swayam Society.
